Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    This is the central class of the game 'Pacman'. It controls the flow of the game by initializing the map, determining the movement of all figures, testing possible collisions, and managing the score, the lifes and the level.
    Author:
    Mira

    • Method Detail

      • actionPerformed

      • testAndSetPosition

        public void testAndSetPosition(Figure figure,
                      java.lang.Boolean lastDirectionFailed,
                      Position pacmanPosition,
                      Position inFrontOfGhostHouse,
                      Direction wantedDirectionOfPacman)
        This method tests and sets the positions of all figures. Therefore it first gets the wanted positions and the tests these positions by invoking the method positionIsValid @see positionIsValid If the wanted position is valid it is set as the new position of the figure. If the wanted position is not valid and the current figure is an instance of Ghost the instance has to render a new position excluding the invalid one. If else the wanted position is not valid, but the current figure is Pacman, Pacman's direction doesn't change. So if the player has made a mistake by choosing an invalid direction Pacman continues moving in his old direction.
        Parameters:
        figure - represents the figure whose position has to be tested
        lastDirectionFailed - true if the last rendered direction was invalid. This parameter is used to decide whether Pacman can render a new direction or has to keep his old one.
        pacmanPosition - represents the position of Pacman needed by the ghosts to render their new direction and position.
        inFrontOfGhostHouse - represents the position right in front of the ghost's house.
        wantedDirectionOfPacman - represents the wanted direction of Pacman, which is given from the GameController to the method renderPosition so that Pacman can calculate his new position following the input of the player.

      • resetDots

        public void resetDots()
        This method is invoked when a new level is loaded. It resets all dots are reset.

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
